intro: Carex oederi var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered sedge, is a perennial plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants commonly found in wet or moist environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces spikes of small, greenish or brownish flowers. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in wet conditions, it is often used in landscaping and ecological restoration projects.
